title: Forge remappings add extra src/
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (2fc85cb 2023-10-05T00:20:48.650196375Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge remappings

### Operating System

Linux

### Describe the bug

Forge remappings are outputting an extra src folder when the import statement already contains that src.
Example:
`forge remappings --root users/0xd1C...b4b/src/`

outputs:

```
@openzeppelin/=node_modules/@openzeppelin/
@uniswap/=node_modules/@uniswap/
permit2/=lib/permit2/src/
solmate/=lib/solmate/src/
```
But if we check a file that uses remapped imports, we see:
```
import {ERC721} from 'solmate/src/tokens/ERC721.sol';
import {ERC1155} from 'solmate/src/tokens/ERC1155.sol';
import {ERC20} from 'solmate/src/tokens/ERC20.sol';
import {IAllowanceTransfer} from 'permit2/src/interfaces/IAllowanceTransfer.sol';
```

I am testing this with the Uniswap Universal Router contracts. This is my directory structure, just to give some context:
```

users/0xd1C...b4b/src/
├── contracts
│   ├── base
│   │   ├── Callbacks.sol
│   │   ├── Dispatcher.sol
│   │   ├── LockAndMsgSender.sol
│   │   ├── RewardsCollector.sol
│   │   └── RouterImmutables.sol
│   ├── interfaces
│   │   ├── external
│   │   │   ├── ICryptoPunksMarket.sol
│   │   │   └── IWETH9.sol
│   │   ├── IRewardsCollector.sol
│   │   └── IUniversalRouter.sol
│   ├── libraries
│   │   ├── Commands.sol
│   │   └── Constants.sol
│   ├── modules
│   │   ├── Payments.sol
│   │   ├── Permit2Payments.sol
│   │   └── uniswap
│   │       ├── v2
│   │       │   ├── UniswapV2Library.sol
│   │       │   └── V2SwapRouter.sol
│   │       └── v3
│   │           ├── BytesLib.sol
│   │           ├── V3Path.sol
│   │           └── V3SwapRouter.sol
│   └── UniversalRouter.sol
├── lib
│   ├── permit2
│   │   └── src
│   │       ├── interfaces
│   │       │   └── IAllowanceTransfer.sol
│   │       └── libraries
│   │           └── SafeCast160.sol
│   └── solmate
│       └── src
│           ├── tokens
│           │   ├── ERC1155.sol
│           │   ├── ERC20.sol
│           │   └── ERC721.sol
│           └── utils
│               └── SafeTransferLib.sol
└── node_modules
    ├── @openzeppelin
    │   └── contracts
    │       ├── token
    │       │   ├── ERC1155
    │       │   │   └── IERC1155Receiver.sol
    │       │   ├── ERC20
    │       │   │   └── IERC20.sol
    │       │   └── ERC721
    │       │       └── IERC721Receiver.sol
    │       └── utils
    │           └── introspection
    │               └── IERC165.sol
    └── @uniswap
        ├── v2-core
        │   └── contracts
        │       └── interfaces
        │           └── IUniswapV2Pair.sol
        └── v3-core
            └── contracts
                ├── interfaces
                │   ├── callback
                │   │   └── IUniswapV3SwapCallback.sol
                │   ├── IUniswapV3Pool.sol
                │   └── pool
                │       ├── IUniswapV3PoolActions.sol
                │       ├── IUniswapV3PoolDerivedState.sol
                │       ├── IUniswapV3PoolEvents.sol
                │       ├── IUniswapV3PoolImmutables.sol
                │       ├── IUniswapV3PoolOwnerActions.sol
                │       └── IUniswapV3PoolState.sol
                └── libraries
                    └── SafeCast.sol
```

> when the import statement already contains that src

the auto remappings detection isn't aware of this, and the trailing src is de-facto standard

you can opt out via auto_detect_remappings = false

> you can opt out via auto_detect_remappings = false

The remappings are exactly what I want. So now I'm just checking if there's a trailing src and I keep two lines, one with it and one without. Seems to solve the problem. Edit: this doesn't work, as the solidity docs state:
 `If prefixes are identical, the one specified last wins.`

Will have to come up with my own remapping detector.
